entities.name: madam pomfrey
entities.description: Madam Pomfrey is a nurse who is present in the hospital wing. She is described as having a kind of fierce approval in her face ("I don’t wonder you’re shocked, Potter," said Madam Pomfrey with a kind of fierce approval in her fa ce.)

entities.name: harry potter
entities.description: Harry Potter is the main character who is present in the hospital wing. He is described as being shocked ("I don’t wonder you’re shocked, Potter," said Madam Pomfrey with a kind of fierce approval in her fa ce.)

entities.name: minerva mcgonagall
entities.description: Minerva McGonagall is a professor who is expected to be present but has gone. She is described as being Stunned ("As if one of them could have Stunned Minerva McGonagall face on by daylight! Cowardice, that’s what it was.")

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is a person who has gone. He is expected to be present but is not ("There was nobody left to tell. Dumbledore had gone, Hagrid had gone, but he had always expected Pr ofessor McGonagall to be there,")

entities.name: hagrid
entities.description: Hagrid is a person who has gone. He is expected to be present but is not ("There was nobody left to tell. Dumbledore had gone, Hagrid had gone, but he had always expected Pr ofessor McGonagall to be there,")

entities.name: hospital wing
entities.description: The hospital wing is a location where Madam Pomfrey and Harry Potter are present. It is described as being teeming with students ("He strode blindly from the hospital wing into the teeming corridor")

entities.name: corridor
entities.description: The corridor is a location where Harry Potter stands after leaving the hospital wing. It is described as being teeming with students ("He strode blindly from the hospital wing into the teeming corridor")

relationships.description: Madam Pomfrey has an opinion about Harry Potter. She is described as having a kind of fierce approval in her face when talking to him ("I don’t wonder you’re shocked, Potter," said Madam Pomfrey with a kind of fierce approval in her fa ce.)

Madam Pomfrey has an opinion about Minerva McGonagall. She describes her as being Stunned ("As if one of them could have Stunned Minerva McGonagall face on by daylight! Cowardice, that’s what it was.")
Harry Potter is talking to Madam Pomfrey. He responds blankly to her words ("Yes," said Harry blankly.)

Harry Potter expected Minerva McGonagall to be present. He is shocked that she has gone ("There was nobody left to tell. Dumbledore had gone, Hagrid had gone, but he had always expected Pr ofessor McGonagall to be there,")

Harry Potter expected Dumbledore to be present. He is shocked that he has gone ("There was nobody left to tell. Dumbledore had gone, Hagrid had gone, but he had always expected Pr ofessor McGonagall to be there,")

Harry Potter expected Hagrid to be present. He is shocked that he has gone ("There was nobody left to tell. Dumbledore had gone, Hagrid had gone, but he had always expected Pr ofessor McGonagall to be there,")
